intro: Burmannia bicolor var. africana, commonly known as the African burmannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking red and white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or swampy areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a waxy texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to waterlogged soils. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
